summary: Email chain between attorneys discussing coordination for the US v Epstein civil forfeiture matter, including acceptance of service for estate executors and clarification of legal representation for the Epstein estate.

persons.name: Marc A. Weinstein
persons.role: Partner at Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP, attorney for Epstein estate
persons.context: Attorney representing the Epstein estate in civil forfeiture matters, coordinating calls and accepting service of process.

persons.name: Andrew Tomback
persons.role: Attorney at White & Case, attorney for Epstein estate
persons.context: Attorney copied on emails regarding representation of Epstein estate in civil forfeiture matter.

persons.name: Bennet Moskowitz
persons.context: Reported to represent the Epstein estate and had discussions with victim counsel that may have broken down.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Executor of Epstein estate who was served with a subpoena; potential privilege issues noted.

persons.name: Richard Kahn
persons.context: Executor of Epstein estate who was served with a subpoena.

persons.name: Martin Weinberg
persons.context: Attorney who introduced Andrew Tomback and Marc Weinstein as representatives for Epstein estate in civil forfeiture matters, indicating a continuing role.

connections.description: Both attorneys representing the Epstein estate in civil forfeiture matters, coordinating calls together.
Weinstein accepted service of process on behalf of Indyke as estate executor.
Weinstein accepted service of process on behalf of Kahn as estate executor.
Moskowitz reportedly represents the Epstein estate and communicated with victim counsel.
Weinberg introduced Weinstein as attorney for Epstein estate in civil forfeiture matters.
Weinberg introduced Tomback as attorney for Epstein estate in civil forfeiture matters.

events.title: Subpoenas served to estate executors
events.description: Subpoenas were served to Darren Indyke and Richard Kahn, executors of the Epstein estate, in the civil forfeiture matter.

events.title: Call scheduled to discuss estate representation
events.description: Marc Weinstein proposed a call for October 23 at 2:30pm to discuss civil forfeiture matters and follow up on previous discussions.

events.title: Introduction of estate attorneys
events.description: Martin Weinberg emailed to introduce Andrew Tomback and Marc Weinstein as attorneys who will represent the Epstein estate in civil forfeiture matters.

keyFacts: Attorneys Marc Weinstein and Andrew Tomback were formally representing the Epstein estate in the US v Epstein civil forfeiture matter as of September 2019.
Discussions between estate attorney Bennet Moskowitz and victim counsel had reportedly broken down, prompting questions about proper channels of communication.
Subpoenas were served to estate executors Darren Indyke and Richard Kahn in October 2019, with potential privilege issues noted for Indyke.
The email chain shows coordination between multiple law firms (Hughes Hubbard & Reed, White & Case, and Martin Weinberg's office) regarding estate representation.
The correspondence indicates ongoing legal proceedings and asset forfeiture actions against Epstein's estate following his death.
